VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Extend Checkout Behavior More Easily with New API Methods

Integrate a customized checkout experience with fewer headaches, or add checkout behavior to a headless B2B Commerce for Visualforce solution. This release replaces the ccrz.cc_api_Cart.placeEOrder public method with new extensible, global methods for the ccrz.ccLogicCartPlace logic service provider class.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: In previous versions of the managed package, the only available extension point for order behavior was the ccrz.cc_hk_Order extension point class. The ccrz.cc_hk_Order.place method called the ccrz.cc_api_Cart.placeEOrder public method for converting a cart to an order, and this public method wasn't extensible. Developing a customized checkout flow was a difficult, complex task and required significant custom code development.

This enhancement provides a more standardized interface and supported architecture for authoring extensions. The ccrz.ccLogicCartPlace logic service provider class includes multiple new methods for evaluating a cart and creating a corresponding order and items. If you prefer, you can continue using the ccrz.cc_hk_Order extension point class for creating an order instead of the new ccrz.ccLogicCartPlace methods.

How: After you upgrade the available global data, a new storefront configuration setting, Use Order Hook, is available under the Checkout module. By default, this setting is FALSE, which specifies that checkout uses the new ccrz.ccLogicCartPlace methods. To revert to the ccrz.cc_hk_Order extension point class, change this setting to TRUE.
